frame.name: Emitting
frame.definition: <def-root>In this frame a <fen>Source_emitter</fen> discharges its <fen>Emission</fen> along a <fen>Path</fen> or to a <fen>Goal</fen>. <ex> (1) <fex name="Source_emitter">The factory</fex> <t>exudes</t> <fex name="Emission">toxic fumes</fex> <fex name="Sub-source">from three large chimneys</fex>.</ex> The <fen>Sub-source</fen> is only present when the actual <fen>Source_emitter</fen> is also given or is present in a possessive. <ex> (2) <fex name="Emission">Light</fex> is <t>emitted</t> <fex name="Source_emitter"> from the tower</fex> . </ex> <ex> (3) <fex name="Emission">Noxious odors</fex> are <t>emitted</t> <fex name="Sub-source">from his feet</fex> . </ex> In (3) we would tag 'his' as <fen>Source_emitter</fen> on a second layer because the inalienable possession on the <fen>Sub-source</fen> indicates the <fen>Source_emitter</fen></def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Manner</fen> in which the <fen>Source_emitter</fen> emits the <fen>Emission</fen></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Source_emitter</fen> emits the <fen>Emission</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Source_emitter
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Source_emitter</fen> is the item from which the <fen>Emission</fen> are discharged.</def-root>

FE.name: Area
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Area</fen> is used for expressions which describe a general area in which emission takes place when the motion is understood to be irregular or not to consist of a single, linear path. </def-root>

FE.name: Depictive
FE.definition: <def-root>Depictive phrase describing the the state of the <fen>Emission</fen> or <fen>Source_emitter</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Distance
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE is an expression characterizing the extent of motion of the <fen>Emission</fen></def-root>

FE.name: Goal
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE is the point at which the <fen>Emission</fen> ends up as a result of the motion. </def-root>

FE.name: Path
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE is a description of a trajectory of motion which is neither a <fen>Source_emitter</fen> or <fen>Sub_source</fen> nor <fen>Goal</fen>. </def-root>

FE.name: Sub-source
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Sub-source</fen> is the subregion of the <fen>Source_emitter</fen> which emits the <fen>Emission</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fex name="Explanation">Explanation</fex> for which the <fen>Source_emitter</fen> emits the <fen>Emission</fen></def-root>

FE.name: Duration
FE.definition: <def-root>The amount of time for which the <fen>Source_emitter</fen> emits the <fen>Emission</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Carrier
FE.definition: <def-root>This is the means of conveyance of the <fen>Emission</fen>. <ex> <fex name="Emission">The acorn seeds</fex> are <t>excreted</t> <fex name="Carrier">in the feces of squirrels</fex> . </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Form
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Form</fen> is the state in which the <fen>Emission</fen> is emitted. <ex> <fex name="Emission"> The signal </fex> is <t>emitted</t> <fex name="Form">as radio waves</fex> . </ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: exude.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: (with reference to moisture or a smell) discharge slowly and steadily.

lexUnit.name: emit.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: discharge; send forth or give out.

lexUnit.name: discharge.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: emit or send out (a liquid, gas, or other substance).

lexUnit.name: radiate.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: emit (light, heat, or other energy) in the form of rays or waves.

lexUnit.name: secrete.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: (of a cell, gland, or organ) produce by secretion

lexUnit.name: excrete.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: (of a living organism) separate and expel as waste (a substance, especially a product of metabolism)

lexUnit.name: void.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: discharge or drain away (water, gases, etc.)

lexUnit.name: emanate.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to give out or emit something
